meanings.definition: A person or thing that frankes.
meanings.sent1: The franker at the post office was very efficient.
meanings.sent2: The new franker in the office helped with sorting mail.
meanings.sent3: The little franker robot was always cheerful and never made mistakes.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like a franker, marking everyone she met with joy.
meanings.sent5: The bright red uniform of the franker made him easy to spot in the crowd.

meanings.sent1: The franker on the desk made stamping letters quick and easy.
meanings.sent2: The old franker in the post office needed repairs.
meanings.sent3: The franker beeped happily every time a letter was stamped.
meanings.sent4: The franker hummed softly, like a little machine marking its territory.
meanings.sent5: The shiny new franker gleamed under the bright lights of the post office.

meanings.definition: To frank or mark (mail) with a postage stamp.
meanings.sent1: She would franker each letter carefully before sending it out.
meanings.sent2: Remember to franker the envelopes before dropping them off.
meanings.sent3: He accidentally frankered his own hand while stamping the mail.
meanings.sent4: The sun seemed to franker the landscape with golden light.
meanings.sent5: The artist's brush seemed to franker the canvas with vibrant colors.

meanings.sent1: They would franker the important documents to ensure they arrived on time.
meanings.sent2: He always frankered his letters to save on postage costs.
meanings.sent3: She decided to franker the invitations instead of hand-delivering them.
meanings.sent4: The wind seemed to franker the letters away, scattering them in all directions.
meanings.sent5: The river would franker the messages downstream, carrying them to distant lands.
